member.name: T:Lastfm.Lib
member.summary: Shared properties.

member.name: P:Lastfm.Lib.Proxy
member.summary: A .
member.value: A web proxy to be used in making all the calls to Last.fm.
member.remarks: To enable using a proxy server, set this value to a , like . To disable using a proxy server, set it to null. Default value is null.

member.summary: Returns the version of this assembly.

member.summary: API Secret
member.value: The Last.fm API Secret.

member.name: P:Lastfm.Services.Session.SessionKey
member.summary: Session Key
member.value: The Session key which represents the user's permission to let you perform "write" operations on his/her profile.
member.remarks: To set this value, you have to call either or and let the user authenticate by theirselves then call to complete the process.

member.summary: Returns true if the session is authenticated.

member.summary: Returns the url for web authentication.

member.name: T:Lastfm.Scrobbling.Connection
member.summary: A connection to the Last.fm scrobbling service. Can be used individually for scrobbling or through a object.

member.name: M:Lastfm.Scrobbling.Connection.doHandshake
member.summary: A handshake is performed at the beginning to retrieve the SessionID, SubmissionURL and NowplayingURL and also everytime the server reports that the SessionID is invalid.

member.name: M:Lastfm.Scrobbling.Connection.ReportNowplaying(Lastfm.Scrobbling.NowplayingTrack)
member.summary: Send the now playing notification.

member.name: M:Lastfm.Scrobbling.Connection.Scrobble(Lastfm.Scrobbling.PlayedTrack)
member.summary: Public scrobble function. Scrobbles a PlayedTrack object.

member.name: M:Lastfm.Scrobbling.Connection.Scrobble(Lastfm.RequestParameters)
member.summary: The internal scrobble function, scrobbles pure request parameters. Could be for more than one track, as specified by Last.fm, but they recommend that only one track should be submitted at a time.

member.name: M:Lastfm.Scrobbling.Connection.doFirstHandshake
member.summary: Does the initial handshake.

member.name: F:Lastfm.Scrobbling.PlaybackSource.User
member.summary: Chosen by the user.

member.name: F:Lastfm.Scrobbling.PlaybackSource.NonPersonalizedBroadcast
member.summary: Non-personalised broadcast (e.g. Shoutcast, BBC Radio 1).

member.name: F:Lastfm.Scrobbling.PlaybackSource.PersonalizedBroadcast
member.summary: Personalised recommendation except Last.fm (e.g. Pandora, Launchcast).

member.name: F:Lastfm.Scrobbling.PlaybackSource.Lastfm
member.summary: Last.fm (any mode). In this case, the 5-digit Last.fm recommendation key must be set to this played track to prove the validity of the submission

member.name: F:Lastfm.Scrobbling.ScrobbleMode.Played
member.summary: If a track has been fully played, or at least 30 or 50% of it has

member.name: F:Lastfm.Scrobbling.ScrobbleMode.Banned
member.summary: If a track has been banned, and it should automatically skip then as well. (only if source is Last.fm)

member.name: F:Lastfm.Scrobbling.ScrobbleMode.Skipped
member.summary: If the track was skipped prematurely (only if source is Last.fm).

member.name: T:Lastfm.Scrobbling.ScrobbleManager
member.summary: A classs to be used by a media player, it caches the tracks to a file first then scrobbles them asynchronously on another thread.

member.name: M:Lastfm.Scrobbling.ScrobbleManager.Queue(Lastfm.Scrobbling.PlayedTrack)
member.summary: Queues a for scrobbling, then scrobbles it on another thread. Or at least tries to. The info is cached locally firt, so there's no fear of losing precious scrobbles.

member.name: M:Lastfm.Scrobbling.ScrobbleManager.Submit
member.summary: Submits the cached scrobbles if any. You shouldn't really concern yourself with calling. It gets called upon each new queued track.

member.name: M:Lastfm.Scrobbling.ScrobbleManager.threadedSubmit
member.summary: Called internally by the scrobbling thread.

member.name: M:Lastfm.Scrobbling.ScrobbleManager.ReportNowplaying(Lastfm.Scrobbling.NowplayingTrack)
member.summary: Relays a Now Playing report to the underlying connection. For luxury purposes only.
